column4: in windows i use coreavc, btw ffmpeg and multicore. but ffmpeg under linux just uses one core, so... its too slow
anyone an idea how to get x264 working under ubuntu 8.10? ffmpeg just uses one Core, so its to slow.
the ffmpeg/mencoder from the Medibuntu repos may have extra features enabled.
how do i add them to my synaptic sources?
ohh, thx alot. searched for this illegal repository for some time :)
you are confuseing the use of the term legal,. :) vs GPL :)
heh - had a large 'discussion' about this topic the other day in here. :p
I know, used to use suse and there i knew where to get this stuff, but not for ubuntu until now :)
cool.. I just dont want any new people seeing a comment and getting the wrong ideas.
i had to convince a guy at work that i COULD in fact legally give him OpenOffice. :)
yes..  The guy couldent understand how someone can legally give stuff away. :)
cool story, would have been nice to overhear this one LIVE ;)
can you tell me one more thing? How can I add xv-support for my media-apps?
never had to mess with it. I imagine its a compile time Option for most apps.
Thx alot for the help, cya
ive noticed a lot of servers having issues today...  could be lag/load, or somthing also.
